title: Given the price, it's an outstanding deal.
body: The product's build quality is exceptional; to be frank, I didn't anticipate such a high level of sharpness and premium craftsmanship. It's crucial to keep this item out of the reach of children, as its sharpness and size is a real concern. I find myself hesitant to use it for day-to-day purposes due to this sharpness factor. Despite my purchase, I recommend their own smaller 'Santoku 6.7' inch knife for everyday use.

title: 'Average Quality'
body: I've been using this knife to cut vegetables and fruits for the past 3-4 months. Initially the sharpness was excellent but within 2 months the knife has become blunt, I've taken care not to swipe the cutting board with knife. The knife was gently used always and to cut only a small quantity of vegetables.

title: 'Perfect Chef Knife at a steal price'
body: This knife feels like an extension of my hand, its smooth and sharp, cuts vegetables and meat all alike in a swift. It'll remain sharp for a few months then all you need is to hone it, and it'll be as good as new. I own a Nakiri from Kai and that's a fabulous knife as well.

title: 'Returned due to not sharp enough'
body: The knife i got, was barely sharp. It struggled in cutting onions. It was not sharper than solimo knife, which are significantly cheaper.  This could just be a defective knife, but that's been my experience. I returned the knife, ordered a different one, costlier but quality.

title: 'Well made'

title: 'Blade quality'
body: Very nice quality blade but I thought the sharpness will remain for quite a good span of time but .it didn't remain sharp after 1 week of use . Need to sharpen the blade again .

title: 'One of the best kitchen knife'
body: 'Absolute legend of a knife to have in your kitchen!'

title: 'Brilliant'
body: This is an amazing, amazingly sharp, and really cheap knife.  I don't know how long it will remain sharp. I don't know if I'll be able to sharpen it to its original keenness. But I know if it only lasts me a year, it will have been magnificent.  It is halfway in length between a vegetable knife and a proper cook's knife. Which is perfect for anybody not constantly slicing huge chunks of beef or pork. It is light and well balanced.  The handle is squarish in cross section, but I presume that is to imitate a wooden handle. The rivets/pins in the handle are clearly fakes, again to replicate the full tang pinned wooden handle style.  None of that matters. It is super sharp value for money.  Right now, at least, I can't recommend it highly enough.
